item.title: Notes on Econometrics - Tests and Statistics
item.description: R^2 t-test F-test (Joint Test / Model Test) Wald Test Wald statistic F-statistic BIC & AIC Nested Model Time Series J Test (Non-Nested Model) PE Test (Linear vs Log) Chow (Breakpoint) Test Durbin-Watson Test (Autocorrelation) Goldfeld-Quandt Test (Heteroskedasticity) Breusch-Pagan Test (Heteroskedasticity) Breusch-Godfrey Test (Autocorrelation) Box-Pierce Test (Autocorrelation) Sargan Test (GIVE Overidentification) Durbin-Wu-Hausman Test (Endogeneity) DF (Dickey-Fuller) Test Unit Root Deterministic Trend ADF (Augmented Dickey-Fuller) Test Spurious Regression vs Cointegration Ljung–Box (Portmanteau) Test (Residual Analysis) Hausman Test (FE vs RE) Read Regression Table Warning: under proofreading

item.title: Notes on Econometrics - Practice Part
item.description: Compare Models Choose Explanatory Variables Choose Approach: OLS / GLS Weird Model R Workout Data Generation OLS Regression Warning: under proofreading All I wanted was a clear & complete guidance (for upcoming exams). Textbook: A Guide to Modern Econometrics Compare Models Choose Explanatory Variables PS2.Q3 Consider the wage regressions from slide 5 (text P86). 1. Compute F-statistics for comparing the loglinear model with and without squared experience.

item.title: Notes on Econometrics - Theory Part
item.description: OLS Model OLS Method Statistical Model Gauss-Markov Assumptions Linear & Loglinear Elasticity OLS Estimator Derive b Unbiasedness of b BLUE Unbiasedness of s^2 Normality Assumption Normality of ε Normality of b Asymptotic Property Converge in Probability & Mean Square LLN (Law of Large Numbers) Consistency of b Consistency of s^2 Asymptotic Nomality Data Problems Multicollinearity Outliers Error Problems Heteroskedasticity Autocorrelation (Serial Correlation) White (HC) Standard Error HAC (Robust) Standard Error GLS (Generalized Least Squares) Estimator EGLS (Feasible Estimated GLS) Estimator WLS (Weighted LS) Estimator Regressor Problem: Endogeneity IV (Instrument Variable) Derive IV IV Estimator ^β_IV GIVE (Generalized IV Estimator) ML (Maximum Likelihood) Model Assumption Property of ^θ Asymptotic Covariance Matrix \(V\) Binary Choice Model Regression Model Probit Model Logit Model Likelihood Ratio Time Series Types of Process Lag Operator Stationary Difference Operator & Integration Deterministic (Linear) Trend OLS Estimation Model Selection Spurious Regression Cointegration Panel Data Entity Fixed Effect Time Fixed Effect Least Squares Dummy Variable (LSDV) Estimator Within Estimator First Difference Estimator Entity and Time Fixed Effect (2-way) Random Effect Feasible GLS (EGLS) Estimator Warning: under proofreading
